alert.note: Alert for Modoc County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 30 at 1:22PM PST until January 01 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Medford OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in California... Pit River near Canby affecting Modoc County. For the Pit River...including Canby...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Pit River near Canby. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, expect moderate flooding in Canby and Lookout in Modoc County and Beiber and Nubeiber in Lassen County. River flow may reach 4300 CFS. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 3.8 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm PST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Pit River Canby 8.5 3.8 Fri 12 pm PS 6.1 8.5 7.4 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 930 PM PST.
